Description (1-2 sentences): A simple weave, with each poi doing one downbeat on opposite sides of the body
Tip 1: Try to keep the poi perpendicular to the floor and parallel to the sides of your body
Tip 2: As you get more comfortable, try to spin slower
Tip 3: It is encouraged to learn both the "left hand over" & "right hand over" variations (refer to video)

Description (1-2 sentences): Both poi spin in the same direction in split time to the side of the body
Tip 1: Try to keep the poi perpendicular to the floor and parallel to each other
Tip 2: The poi should be spinning in split time; when one poi is pointing down, the other is pointing up

Description (1-2 sentences): Same time, same direction done with both hands together
Tip 1: The planes of each hand are on a slight slant to prevent the poi from hitting each other

Description (1-2 sentences): Both poi switch spin direction through the turning the body
Tip 1: Point your wrists down while turning

Description (1-2 sentences): A two beat weave done in floor plane
Tip 1: Your hands should be pointing in opposite directions at all time

Description (1-2 sentences): A wrap that hits the forearm
Tip 1: Aim to hit your arm an inch above the top of the glowstick; there's a sweet spot that shouldn't hurt your arm

Description (1-2 sentences): A simple weave, with each poi doing one downbeat on one side of the body and two downbeats on the opposite side of the body
Tip 1: Try to keep the poi perpendicular to the floor and parallel to the sides of your body
Tip 2: As you get more comfortable, try to spin slower

Description (1-2 sentences): Similar to the 3 beat weave, but in reverse
Tip 1: Most moves will not have a "reverse" move page dedicated to it as it

Description (1-2 sentences): A two beat weave done above the head in wall plane
Tip 1: Because this is one of the first moves that is learned in wall plane, it will take time to get used to spinning your poi without slanting
Tip 2: One of the most difficult parts of this move is getting it into split time. Count beats in your head if it helps.
Tip 3: Most of the move should be done through wrist movement

Description (1-2 sentences): A windmill, but the front beats are opened up

A sequence of pendulums that don't require you to move your hand
Both poi tangle and are pulled to create a fast spinning buzzsaw
Both poi tangle and untangle in wall plane
A weave that involves spinning poi behind the back
A body tracer behind your back, along the arm
A mercedes (triquetra) done along with a pendulum instead of an extension

Two antispin flowers spinning in opposite directions that alternate extensions

Both hands spin in opposite directions and form a northern and southern triangle
The rotation of the poi such that the hand follows the path of the poi. Looks like a static spin, but is significantly harder.
